channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2023090496
item.description:
Report X-2023090496

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At the unloading phase, package was discovered to be leaking some of its contents. It was then placed in a red hazmat drum and taken to the hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: Package failed at the base of the lid, the cap of the drum is partially lifted, causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a red hazmat bin to prevent further damage/leakage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHEN PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA THE BOX WAS WET I THEN INSPECTED IT BY OPENING IT AND DISCOVERING ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAS A LOOSE CAP SO BOTTLES WERE THEN PLACED IN A DRUM DescribePack: ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING THE LIQUID TO LEAK DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: TIGHTEND THE CAP AND PLACED THEM IN A DRUM

  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED FOR LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE PROCESS, RESPONDER ALSO DISCOVERED SODIUM HYDROXIDE, BEADS INSIDE PACKAGE. RESPONDER NOTIFIED RMP FOR SUSPECTED UNDECLARED. RMP CALLED HMSC. PHOTOS TAKEN HELD FOR ADG COMPLIANCE RELEASE/INSTRUCTION.

item.title: Report X-2023090741
item.description:
Report X-2023090741

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023090741: AT LEAKER DISCOVERY LOCATION" LEAKING PACKAGE CAME DOWN THE CONVEYOR BELT. BELT WAS STOPPED, NOT TOUCHED, MOVED AWAY, PICK-OFF NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR. RESPONDER CONTAINED AND PROCESSED THROUGH DMP. X-2023090742: UPON CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE OUTSIDE OF THE BOX WAS WET FROM A LEAKING BOTTLE INSIDE BUT NO OTHER LIQUID WAS PRESENT ON THE GROUND. X-2023090743: RESPONE TO LEAKER AT DOOR, RESPONDER FOUND LEAKING HAZMAT IN UN SPECIFICATION FIBERBOARD BOX CONTAINING FOUR PLASTIC 1 GALLON BOTTLE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE TO CLEAN UP CORROSIVE LEAKER AND TAKE BACK TO PSC.

item.title: Report X-2023090758
item.description:
Report X-2023090758

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: HILLSBORO
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: LEAKING PACKAGE WAS CALLED FOR AT 5:52AM. RESPONDER CONTAINED LEAKER, CLEANED UP SPILL, AND TOOK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE PSC FOR FURTHER INSPECTION. THE SIGHT OF THE AEROSOL CAN AND THE BOX HAVE NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS MARKINGS PROMPTED AN SDS SEARCH. THE LEAKER WAS SEARCHED IN EDMP AND AN SDS SEARCH RESULTED IN FINDING IT TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. THE HMSC WAS CALLED AND THE PRODUCT PROCESSED IN EDMP.

item.title: Report X-2023090756
item.description:
Report X-2023090756

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PSC WAS CALLED AND A RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED TO THE UNLOAD, DOOR 35. THE RESPONDER GOT TO THE DOOR AND A IRREG SWEEPER INFORMED THE RESPONDER THAT THE IRREG HAD AN ODOR COMING FROM IT BUT WAS UNSURE WHAT WAS WRONG WITH IT. THE RESPONDER COULD SEE THAT THE CORNER OF THE PACKAGE WAS TORN AND COULD SEE INSIDE THE PACKAGE AND COULD IDENTIFY THE INNER CONTAENTS AS "RUST-OLEUM, EPOXY SHIELD". THE RESPONDER ALSO NOTICED THE ODOR COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. WHEN MOVING THE PACKAGE THE RESPONDER COULD TELL THE PACKAGE WAS WELL OVER THE 70 POUNDS LISTED ON THE LABEL. THE WEIGHT AND ODOR MADE THE RESPONDER SUSPECT IT WAS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT.WHEN RETURNING TO THE PSC THE RESPNDER NOTIFIED THE NIGHTSORT RMP THAT THEY POSSIBLE HAD AN UNDECLARED.THE RMP LOOKED UP THE SDS AND IN SECTION 14 OF THE SDS THE PRODUCT STATES AS THE PROPER DOT SHIPPING NAME"PAINT PRODUCTS IN LIMITED QUANTITES". THE RMP NOTIFIED HMSC TO BEGIN PROCESSING AS A POTENTIAL UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

item.title: Report I-2023080031
item.description:
Report I-2023080031

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-01T00:35:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: BAKER CITY
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 12:00PM on Tuesday June 20th 2023 The Savannah transport driver (Larry) noticed a leak near the landing gear from his trailer while stopped at a truck stop in Baker City, OR. He immediately place a plastic 5gl bucket underneath it to contain the drips. ~12: 15pm Savannah contacted Aaron Sanislo at Heritage Env. to notify us of the situation. ~12:30pm Aaron contacted Master Env. in Meridian ID who directed him to Steve Rich Env. in Baker City OR. ~1:OOpm Steve Rich arrived on scene reviewed the situation and decided they were incapable of handling the situation and they departed the scene. ~1 :30pm Aaron contacted Master Env. Again to see if they could respond. They said they needed to check with their team in the field and get back to us. ~2:20 Master Env. informed us the earliest they could respond was Thursday June 22nd. So we widened our search. ~ 2:47pm Mike From Heritage Env. contacted Justin Widmer@ Patriot Env. in Richland WA to see if they could respond. They could. Provided Justin with the Savannah Transport drivers (Larry) cell phone info and a brief detailed description of the situation. Please see detailed timeline report from Patriot Environmental continued on additional sheet.
